skillTree.localised_description: Each victory reinvigorates Khorne's champions to seek more bloodshed.

effects.description: Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Replenishes 30% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after razing a settlement

skillTree.localised_description: The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
At times, this servant of Khorne storms across the battlefield with arrows lodged in his chest. However, they seem to do little but further stoke the raging fire of his wrath.
Few magics can worm their way through this one's skull; their Khornate collar offers adequate protection, as does the impenetrable, relentless fury infecting his mind.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Each skull torn from a dying foe, each bite of carnage, feeds my essence, mending flesh and igniting hunger for more-more slaughter!"

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: "My enemies stumble-stagger, their blood thickened, their forms faltering, trampled beneath the tide of death bearing down upon them!"

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: "Charge-charge, break them in an endless wave! For only in glorious death are we unyielding, unstoppable - unbroken in the slaughter!"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: "Around me, the madness spreads - no thought remains but the howl of blades and the sweet-slick tang of fresh-killed prey!"

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: "Their pathetic magics fuel my rage - each spell an insult answered with ferocious strength, and my wrath unleashed in red-red ruin!"
"Yesss-yes, watch me ascend in death, a blazing storm of fury reborn with fiery wings and unrelenting claws to claim the skulls owed in rivers of blood!"

effects.description: Replenishes 15% campaign movement range after winning a battle

Blood Swarm armies: +3 units on creation
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere – even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle – spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: Once a minor Skaven warlord clan lost in obscurity, Clan Haematoma rose to prominence under the ruthless leadership of Krethak Goretail, who abandoned the Horned Rat to embrace the bloodlust of Khorne. Their warriors, marked by ritual scars and crimson-streaked fur, are ferocious berserkers driven to slaughter by fanatical devotion to the Blood God. The clan has forged an unholy bond with Khorne’s daemonic legions, summoning Bloodletters, Juggernauts, and even towering Bloodthirsters to lead their battles. With their blood-drenched banners flying high, Clan Haematoma rampages through the Under-Empire and beyond, leaving trails of carnage that testify to their unrelenting worship of slaughter and war.

effects.description: Khorne Undercities: When establishing undercities, the city above can be gifted to a Khorne faction for rewards.
Praise the Blood God: By performing a gruesome ritual to Khorne, Krethak Goretail can summon daemonic reinforcements.
In Glorious Battle: As Krethak Goretail and his subordinates win battles, the Blood God smiles upon them.
Diplomatic relations: +10 with Warriors of Chaos and Norsca

Attribute: Mark of Khorne for all Clan Haematoma units
	(all armies)

related_attributes.bullet_text:
A unit with the Mark of Khorne has:
	➕ Frenzy Passive Ability
	➕ Increased  Spell Resistance
	➕ Increased  Armour
	➖ Reduced  Melee Defence

effects.description:
Upkeep: +300% for all non-Haematoma units
	(all armies)

Recruitment cost: +300% for all non-Haematoma units
	(all armies)
Immune to Chaos corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

items.colour_text: Forged in the molten depths of the Black Gulch, the Flensing Axe is jagged, notched by a thousand kills, and stained eternally with the gore of the slain. Each strike does not merely hew flesh but flays it, tearing muscle from bone in gruesome tribute to the Blood God. With every foe claimed, the axe's hunger only deepens, whispering in guttural, wordless fury for more, ever more. Those who fall before its ravenous edge do not simply die - they rise again, though not as warriors. Instead, their skulls are wrenched from their ruined husks, ablaze with hellfire, and hurled forth as fiery missiles of divine wrath. To stand before Krethak in battle is to witness a barrage of burning bone, the faces of the fallen twisted in an eternal rictus of agony as they strike down their former allies with Khorne’s merciless judgment. Every death feeds the carnage, every kill hastens annihilation, until the battlefield itself becomes a writhing altar of bone, fire, and ruin.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

items.colour_text: The Skullmount Plate is a towering suit of battle-scarred armour, each piece adorned with grinning skulls - trophies ripped from the most defiant foes of Krethak Goretail, their once-proud forms now hollow offerings to the Blood God. The armour pulses faintly, as if alive with unspent rage, and glows with veins of molten brass that blaze brighter with every death on the battlefield. The skulls adorning its surface are more than trophies - they whisper to Krethak, granting him unholy insight into his enemies’ weaknesses and stoking his bloodlust to unparalleled heights.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The desert wastes of the Badlands are blessed cover for the rats of Clan Gnaw. At least, they are when Duneskulk is leading them, for he has a sixth sense at navigating through the wastes.
